International & Foreign Law   Tags: asia, australian law, canada, china, constitutions, europe, foreign law, hong kong, international law, japan, law, legal research, pacific, papua new guinea, united kingdom, united states  

A guide to international and foreign law research.

Books and Commentary

Canadian Encyclopedic Digest (Online) - Westlaw

The Canadian legal system, 4th ed - Gerald L. Gall
Call Number: KL20.G34 1995

Legal research and writing, 3rd ed - Ted Tjaden
Call Number: KL155.T53 2010

A practical guide to legal research, 2nd ed - Sue Milne ; Kay Tucker
Call Number: KL155.M55 2010
Chapter 7 United Kingdom, New Zealand and Canada

Canadian guide to uniform legal citation
Call Number: K114.C36 - Law Library Reference

Comments (0)
 

Primary and Secondary Resources

For a comprehensive list of general resources, including books, research guides and country information, click on Foreign Law.

  • CanLII - Canadian Legal Information Institute
    free access to federal and provincial cases and legislation
  • Government of Canada
    Primary access point for Canadian government information
  • Parliament of Canada
  • Department of Justice - Justice Laws
    Legislation
  • Supreme Court of Canada
  • Canadian Law Reform Agencies
  • Canadian Federal Legislation
    Includes Acts, Bills and Regulations
  • Canada Treaty Information
    Maintained by the Treaty Section of Canada's Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade
  • Federal Court of Canada decisions
    Searchable full text of published decisions from 1992. Includes recent unpublished decisions.
  • Law Central Canada
    Canadian primary legal materials, such as statutes, cases and regulations
  • Lexis
    Canadian case law and journals
    Find laws by country or region>Canada
  • Westlaw
    Canadian case law and journals
    From the Directory, click on "International/Worldwide Materials" and then "Databases listed alphabetically by country or region."
  • Canada Gazette
    The Canada Gazette is the official newspaper of the Government of Canada and has been published since 1841. It contains formal public notices, official appointments, proposed regulations, regulations and public Acts of Parliament from government departments and agencies.
  • Government and Legislative Libraries Online Publications Portal
    Access to the government publications and select legislative materials found in Canadian legislative and parliamentary libraries.
Comments (0)
 

Blogs

  • Slaw
    SLAW - A Canadian co-operative weblog about any and all things legal.
  • Library Boy
    Legal research news from an Ottawa law librarian
Comments (0)
 

Research Guides and Websites

  • Doing Legal Research in Canada
    LLRX.com guide by Ted Tjaden
  • Best Guide to Canadian legal research
    Tips for researching Canadian and other countries laws, such as the United States, United Kingdom and the European Union
  • Bora Laskin Law Library: How to Locate Canadian Legislation
    by Susan Barker. Provides easy access to online sources of Canadian federal and provincial statutes, regulations, bills and debates in legislative assemblies
  • Sources of Canadian Law on the Web
    by Louise Tsang. Guide to primary sources, parliamentary and government sites
  • Osgoode Hall Law School Library: Web Links: Canada
  • American Law Sources On-line
    Maintained by LawSource Inc. A comprehensive collection of links to free online sources of US and Canadian law. Includes an outline of the Canadian legal system.
  • Canadian Judicial System
    From the Supreme Court of Canada
  • Guide to the Canadian Court System
    From the Department of Justice
  • Legaltree
    Collaboratively built website with legal research resources maintained by the site administrators, and legal literature contributed by lawyers in the Canadian legal community
